column4: Hi, I'm new to Linux and Ubuntu and I'm having trouble to use java-based applications. I'm trying to use jEdit but I can't type double quotes ("), only single quotes '. I'm using us-international keyboard layout...
you can change the layout in gnome, and read where the characters are :)
I'm not on ubuntu now, so it's a bit hard to help you
if that doesn't work, you can check which characters you get trough the command line (but that's evil)
oops, I'm using KDE... Well all GTK and QT applications works with " as you can see :) only java applications. I have the same trouble with netbeans
eww, that's evil
I can't even try a hello world example without copying and pasting only....
did you try netbeans?
or does that give you the same problem
yes, same problem
I didn't try eclipse.... Lemme check, but i think it will work
in that case, it doesn't solve your problem, but you can get further...
maybe you need to install an other java vm . . . (the official one might work)
I dont think i have many choices, but I think it will work since its GTK... Only Swing (or the kit jedit and netbeans uses)
Thats a possibility, I'm using sun's
hmmm, suns should work :)
Ok, eclipse works, thanks! But well.... The problem is veeeery weird
you can get further... I do wonder what the problem is (maybe a configuration here or there)
Can you tell me so I can investigate?
I honoustly can't tell you... there must be some configuration file conserning java... but I don't know where it is, and what is in it... so...
Ok, no problem, thanks!
np
